profile_positions.title: Head of People Operations and Rewards

profile_positions.description:
As Irdeto's Global Manager Total Rewards I am responsible globally for :

•	Building a new Total Rewards team and operating model 
•	Building and implementing a Total Rewards Philosophy and Framework to align with Irdeto’s 
        winning culture and best in class employee experience
•	Managing the design, roll-out and implementation of our annual Employee Incentive Schemes, 
        including Sales and Business Development
•	Ensuring that we offer competitive Total Reward packages for all employees globally and building 
        out a strategic plan to align any discrepancies where needed
•	Equity Schemes
•	Recognition Programme
•	Employee Assistance Programme
•	Benefit Programmes including retirement, medical, life, death and disability
profile_positions.title: Global Manager Total Rewards

profile_positions.description:
As a Sr. HR Generalist at Irdeto I was responsible for approximately 260 employees in my business groups which include: Technology, Finance, Legal, Procurement, HR, Sales and Services, Connected Transport and Broadcast Managed Services. Across these groups I was also responsible for supporting 49 people managers.  I had employees across multiple countries including The Netherlands, South Africa, Russia, UK, Dubai, Germany, Poland and Turkey. 

Major responsibilities include, but were not limited to:
• Business partner activities for my business units
• First point of contact for managers and employees
• Lead HR person for benchmarking and promotion proposals
• Preparing all documents for assignments and relocations from and to EMEA
• Employee Relations
• Running onboarding workshops for new hires
• Conducting 3 month reviews and exit interviews with employees and following up on action items from these discussions
• Supporting the execution and follow up on actions items from the Employee Opinion Survey
• Managing legal procedures & employment terminations
• Designing and facilitating team effectiveness workshops, including DiSC workshops
• Case manager of long term illness sickness cases
• Set up and evaluate Performance Improvement Plans for employees
• Supporting people managers in annual processes such as Performance Management, Salary Planning, Bonus Planning
• Participation in global HR-related workstreams and projects 
• First point of contact for benefits questions across EMEA
• Ad-hoc requests from the business 
• Supporting Regional HR Manager where needed
• Lease Cars administration
• Ad-hoc HR projects 
• Supporting in HR audits (both internally and externally)
• Payroll input
• Responsible for ensuring data accuracy in our HRIS system for my groups
• In liaison with the NL Worker’s Council for certain projects
profile_positions.title: Sr. HR Generalist - EMEA

profile_positions.description:
Within my role as a Compensation and Benefits Analyst I was responsible for:

•Consulting with regional HR as well as international compensation on compensation strategy, policies and procedures.
•Assisting in the research, analysis and design of our regional compensation strategy, including pay mix design, salary ranges and perquisites, in conjunction with our broader global compensation philosophy.
•Assisting in the annual compensation processes (Merit, Bonus, etc.) for the Europe Region.
•Assisting in bench marking projects on both compensation & benefits, including job evaluation, internal and external analysis and final recommendations.
•Auditing our key compensation and HRIS systems.
•Developing effective relationships with our key stakeholders, including, Finance, HR, Legal and Senior Management.

As the HR Business Partner for our office in The Netherlands I was responsible for:

•Driving changes in the organization in line with the key organizational & departmental objectives.
•Co- developing & executing HR strategies and taking part in European HR project teams to continuously improve Mattel’s HR services.
•Driving performance management and optimal utilization of performance management tools.
•Conducting Training & Development needs analysis for the IT team across the region and various teams in the NL office
•Managing day-to-day HR issues or concerns, working directly with employees and managers to achieve resolutions
•Supporting managers in managing their teams
•Overseeing the optimal realization of talent acquisition
•Leading and executing on our on-boarding processes
profile_positions.title: HR Business Partner and Compensation & Benefits Analyst

profile_positions.description:
I started at Catlin as a HR Graduate Trainee and spent time working both within HR and in the business.
 
* During my 9 month HR Services rotation my day to day work varied each day depending on the queries that came into our centralised HR inbox which ranged between simple questions to complex problems. Alongside supporting on the inbox I also managed my own new joiners, company inductions, probations, fixed term contract extensions, contract amendments, leavers, maternity leave employees, training courses, lunchtime tutorials among other projects and updated employee records in Oracle. Within my role in the Services Team I also supported other HR Departments with any queries that they had and helped from an administrative perspective.

* I also spent 4 months working within the Talent Development team as part of my rotation schedule. Within the T&D team the work was a lot more project based and I spent most of my time working on the Global Orientation Programme for the new CDP’ers joining in Sept 2014 and the Recruitment Campaign for the 2015 CDP and SIP. This involved liaising with marketing agencies, the internal marketing team and our recruitment team. I was also involved with the testing of our new Applicant Tracking System.

* As part of the graduate programme I also spent some within the Underwriting and Claims departments to gain a deeper understanding of their roles and processes. Alongside these rotations I worked with the Claims team on designing new marketing material for them and conducted a 3 month research project on whether Catlin’s stock market valuation was fairly valued. This involved conducting interviews with Senior Members of the business including the Chairman and CEO, comparing our financial results, global footprint and product mix with those of our competitors globally and analysing analyst reports on all insurance companies both within and outside of the London Market. This project was then delivered to a panel whilst I was in Cologne.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Trainee- Human Resources

profile_positions.description: * Assisted the Compensation and Benefits team with setting up a new Shared Service Department in the Amstelveen office. The new department is accountable and responsible for all European payroll processing and this role was to help with the transition of payroll activities in the local countries into Amstelveen. This role involved coordination between contacts across Europe and the design of process maps for each payroll country.
